meanings.definition: A period of time spent in a particular job or occupation.
meanings.sent1: During his stints as a waiter, he learned valuable customer service skills.
meanings.sent2: She completed multiple stints as a volunteer at the local animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: His short stints as a chef left the customers hungry for more.
meanings.sent4: Her stint as a teacher opened her eyes to the joys of education.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's stint in space was filled with awe and wonder.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit in amount or number.
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised him to stint on sugary drinks to improve his health.
meanings.sent2: She decided to stint her expenses to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: He didn't want to stint on compliments, so he praised her outfit.
meanings.sent4: The chef refused to stint on quality ingredients for his famous dish.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the players not to stint on their efforts during the game.

meanings.sent1: She always stints on using paper to save trees.
meanings.sent2: He tends to stint on buying new clothes to save money.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to stint on nuts and save them for winter.
meanings.sent4: The wise old man would never stint on sharing his knowledge with others.
meanings.sent5: The family had to stint on electricity usage during the power outage.
